FuncDef:
The ttl-mode command is used to set the TTL processing mode for restoring original packets that receiving from SF.
The undo ttl-mode command is used to restore the default TTL mode.
By default, the TTL processing mode is the uniform type.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a TTL value.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After packets are transmitted from the SF to the SFF, the TTL of the original packets is processed in the following modes:
Uniform mode: On the egress node, the TTL value of inner packets is subtracted by 1 and mapped to the IPv6 TTL field.Pipe mode: On the egress node, the TTL value of inner packets is not mapped to the IPv6 TTL field. Instead, the value of ttl-value minus 1 is directly assigned to the IPv6 TTL field.
